Description: Sheet of papyrus with hieratic text in black ink; there are legible traces of a palimpsest Late Ramesside Letter across the entire surface of the sheet, but it has been reused to write a short charm against ill health or similar.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Published: R.J. Demarée The Bankes Late Ramesside Papyri (British Museum Research Publication 155; London: British Museum Press 2005), 26-28, 60-61, 66.

William John Bankes travelled in Egypt in 1815-1818, and is known to have collected papyri at Thebes on his second journey to Upper Egypt (1818). This papyrus is from a batch of Late Ramesside Letters acquired in 1818 by Bankes. It is still mounted on early 19th century grease- paper, with the notation by Bankes himself marking it as document 'C'.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139360) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139360)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
